name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All personnel on site have completed the site specific induction
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Site induction signed.
1.2 - Safety measures are in place, Safe Work Mathod Statement (SWMS) undertaken
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, CEMP, TMP & SWMS
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Health and Safety Co-Ordination Plan
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer, Site Foreman & Superintendent
1.3 - Check that current revision drawings are being used
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Issued For Construction (IFC) and latest available revision used
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Project Drawings / Drawing Register
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Latest Revision Drawings
1.4 - Confirm understanding of current CEMP and CHMP related to the work area and that all prescribed environmental controls are in place
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All environmental measures to be implemented as per current EMP and local authorities. Sediment control measures to be installed and protected vegetation to be clearly identified
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings, CEMP, CHMP
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Current Excavation Permit signed and specific for the area where works will be executed.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate that all works meet level and location requirements. The establishment and integrity of the survey network shall be verified before commencing any survey and setout activity. IFC and latest available revision used
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Survey records & pegs on the ground
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: No fill is to be placed on the prepared areas until the the area has been reviewed by the Superintendent
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Area reviewed by Superintendent, Signed ITP
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Placement surface textured to ensure layers keyed into each other.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Layers placed and spread in uniform compacted layers not thicker than 200mm.

○ A procedure shall be established to verify that compacted layers do not exceed the specified maximum thickness. Verification records must provide evidence of measurements taken at least every three layers in consistent locations across the filled areas, and must be retained with the lot records.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Areas upon which fills are to be constructed, layers of fill shall be test rolled in accordance with Section 173. Where compaction methods have been deemed acceptable, proof rolling increments can be decreased as required.
○ Superintendent to be present during all test rolling.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 204.12 Cl.173.03
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Proof Roll Form completed & signed.
FREQUENCY: Prior to construction of subgrade layer

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The top of the Class 3 material, Cut Floor Level and subgrade surfaces shall be prepared to level and shape within the tolerances specified in Clause 204.03(g) to produce a smooth, hard, tightly bound surface, free from depressions capable of holding water).
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 204.15, Cl. 204.03(g)
FREQUENCY: Prior to construction of subgrade layer

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Surface is smooth, hard, tightly bound and free from depressions which are capable of holding water. Surface is not to be more than 15mm or less than 30mm from what is specificed in IFC drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Compaction testing to ensure 100% Standard Compaction Density Ratio
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.204.13(a), Cl.204.13(b), Table 204.131, Table 204.142
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Compaction Test Records
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
